required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Orange Juice, Hesperidin and Their Role in Vascular Health Benefit
clinical_study.official_title: Orange Juice, Hesperidin and Their Role in Vascular Health Benefit: a Human Double Blind, Randomized, Controlled, Cross Over Study

collaborator.agency: UMR 1019, Unité de Nutrition Humaine, INRAE, Auvergne-Rhône Alpes Center
Department of Beverage Research, Chair of analysis and technology of plant-based foods, Geisenheim University

brief_summary.textblock: Although epidemiological studies have associated the consumption of sugary beverages with adverse health effects, experimental studies have demonstrated that the metabolic response of the human body to fruit juice as compared to artificial beverages is substantially different. Fruit juices do not just provide sugars and related calories, but they are rich sources of bioactive compounds especially of flavonoids. Flavanones constitute a class of flavonoids that are specifically and abundantly found in citrus fruits, with hesperidin being the major compound in orange. From prospective cohort studies, higher intakes of flavanones are associated with a lower incidence of mortality by cardiovascular disease (CVD). This relation is supported by results from a number of animal studies demonstrating a slowdown in atherosclerosis development and vascular protective effects in dietary interventions with flavanones. Randomized, controlled clinical trials to corroborate the suggested vasculo-protective effects of orange juice presumably mediated by the flavanones are scarce and available data do not allow to draw firm conclusions about their efficacy. To fill this gap, the "HESPER-HEALTH study" conducted in humans will assess the vascular protective effects of 100% orange juice consumption and evaluate the contribution of hesperidin in these effects.

detailed_description.textblock:
This human dietary intervention study is a double blind, randomized, placebo controlled, cross over trial with 3 arms, carried out on subjects with predisposition to cardiovascular diseases (CVD) based on age and overweight. This study aims to demonstrate the vascular protective effects (with Flow Mediated Dilatation (FMD) as main criteria) of the consumption of a flavanone rich orange juice or of orange flavanones by comparison with a control sugary drink alone.
The 42 recruited participants will receive the 3 drinks in a random order. For each subject, the study is divided into 3 identical experimental periods of 45 days (period 1,2,3): including 3 days prior to the beginning of the product intake, during which specific dietary guidelines, samplings and measures will be asked to be performed at home followed by a 6 weeks period of consumption of each of the 3 beverages). A period of 4 to 6 weeks of wash-out is planned between each experimental period.
To summarize: Visit 1 (D-14) = inclusion, Visit 2 (D1: baseline) to 3 (D42) = period 1, Visit 3 (D42) to 4 (D70) = wash out 1, Visit 4 (D70) to 5 (D111) = period 2, Visit 5 (D111) to 6 (D139) = wash out 2, Visit 6 (D139) to 7 (D180) = period 3. The wash-out periods (minimum duration: 4 weeks) may be extended until 6 weeks for the convenience of participants.
The protocol includes a total of 7 visits to PIC/CIC Inserm 1405 of the Clermont-Fd University Hospital.
The total duration of the study will be between 28 and 34 weeks

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)
study_design_info.masking_description: drinks kits will be labelled and packaged according to the pre-established randomization plane by the pharmacy department of University Hospital of Clermont-Ferrand, France. Kits will be distributed in a blind fashion for each cross over period on the basis of the randomization schedule.

primary_outcome.description: The endothelial function will be assessed using the non-invasive ultrasound technique of flow mediated dilatation of the brachial artery. FMD measure is the percentage of dilation of brachial artery in response to a reactive hyperaemia induced by the release of a transient occlusion of the brachial artery in fasted state

The endothelial function will be assessed using the non-invasive ultrasound technique of flow mediated dilatation of the brachial artery. FMD measure is the percentage of dilation of brachial artery in response to a reactive hyperaemia induced by the release of a transient occlusion of the brachial artery in fasted state

The endothelial function will be assessed using the non-invasive ultrasound technique of flow mediated dilatation of the brachial artery. FMD measure is the percentage of dilation of brachial artery in response to a reactive hyperaemia induced by the release of a transient occlusion of the brachial artery in fasted state

The endothelial function will be assessed using the non-invasive ultrasound technique of flow mediated dilatation of the brachial artery. The endothelial function will be assessed using the non-invasive ultrasound technique of flow mediated dilatation of the brachial artery. FMD measure is the percentage of dilation of brachial artery in response to a reactive hyperaemia induced by the release of a transient occlusion of the brachial artery in fasted state

The endothelial function will be assessed using the non-invasive ultrasound technique of flow mediated dilatation of the brachial artery. FMD measure is the percentage of dilation of brachial artery in response to a reactive hyperaemia induced by the release of a transient occlusion of the brachial artery in fasted state

secondary_outcome.measure: Sex
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day -14
secondary_outcome.description: Participant sex (man/women) will be requested.

secondary_outcome.measure: Age
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 34
secondary_outcome.description: Participant age (years) will be requested.

secondary_outcome.measure: Basal Systolic Blood Pressure
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day -14
secondary_outcome.description: Blood pressure measure (mm Hg) with monitor.

secondary_outcome.measure: Basal Heart Rate
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day -14
secondary_outcome.description: Heart rate measure (beat/min) with monitor.

secondary_outcome.measure: D-3 visit systolic Blood Pressure (BP)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1, Day 42, Day 70, Day 111, Day 139, Day 180
secondary_outcome.description: Self-monitored blood pressure (mmHg) at home with tensiometer, at home the morning, 3 days before the visit, in fasted state.

secondary_outcome.measure: D-3 visit diastolic BP
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1, Day 42, Day 70, Day 111, Day 139, Day 180
secondary_outcome.description: Self-monitored blood pressure (mmHg) at home with tensiometer, at home the morning, 3 days before the visit, in fasted state.

secondary_outcome.measure: D-3 visit Heart Rate
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1, Day 42, Day 70, Day 111, Day 139, Day 180
secondary_outcome.description: Self-monitored heart rate (beat/min) at home with tensiometer,at home the morning, 3 days before the visit, in fasted state.

secondary_outcome.measure: FMD post prandial endothelial response 3h after a challenge meal
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1, Day 42, Day 70, Day 111, Day 139, Day 180
secondary_outcome.description: Assessment of the postprandial endothelial response to a challenge meal (900kcal, fresh cream, sucrose and milk proteins) by measuring FMD (percent) using ultrasound technique, 3h after intake of the full daily dose of study products concomitantly with challenge meal.

secondary_outcome.measure: FMD post prandial endothelial response 6h after a challenge meal
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1, Day 42, Day 70, Day 111, Day 139, Day 180
secondary_outcome.description: Assessment of the postprandial endothelial response to a challenge meal by measuring FMD (percent) using ultrasound technique, 6h after intake of the full daily dose of study products concomitantly with challenge meal.

secondary_outcome.measure: Arterial compliance assessment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1, Day 42, Day 70, Day 111, Day 139, Day 180
secondary_outcome.description: Noninvasive measure with Sphygmocor (AtCor Medical Pty. Ltd) of pulse transit time between carotid artery and femoral artery. The carotid-femoral Pulse Wave Velocity (PWV) (m/sec) is an established index of arterial stiffness,in fasted state.

secondary_outcome.measure: Rest flow by Flowmetry Laser Doppler (FLD) in fasted state
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1, Day 42, Day 70, Day 111, Day 139, Day 180
secondary_outcome.description: Vascular endothelial function in the micro-vascular compartment will be assessed using the measurement of the rest flow using laser-Doppler system at the level of the skin of the hand, in fasted state

secondary_outcome.measure: Occlusion area by FLD in fasted state
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1, Day 42, Day 70, Day 111, Day 139, Day 180
secondary_outcome.description: Vascular endothelial function in the micro-vascular compartment will be assessed using the measurement of the occlusion area using laser-Doppler system at the level of the skin of the hand by following the response to a reactive hyperaemia induced by the release of a transient occlusion of the brachial artery (same stimulus as for FMD measurement) in fasted state

secondary_outcome.measure: Hyperaemia area by FLD in fasted state
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1, Day 42, Day 70, Day 111, Day 139, Day 180
secondary_outcome.description: Vascular endothelial function in the micro-vascular compartment will be assessed using the measurement of the hyperaemia area using laser-Doppler system at the level of the skin of the hand by following the response to a reactive hyperaemia induced by the release of a transient occlusion of the brachial artery (same stimulus as for FMD measurement) in fasted state

secondary_outcome.measure: Hyperaemia area / occlusion area ratio by FLD in fasted state
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1, Day 42, Day 70, Day 111, Day 139, Day 180
secondary_outcome.description: Vascular endothelial function in the micro-vascular compartment will be assessed using the ratio hyperaemia area / occlusion area determined by FLD.

secondary_outcome.measure: Maximal flow by FLD in fasted state
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1, Day 42, Day 70, Day 111, Day 139, Day 180
secondary_outcome.description: Vascular endothelial function in the micro-vascular compartment will be assessed using the measurement of the maximal flow using laser-Doppler system at the level of the skin of the hand by following the response to a reactive hyperaemia induced by the release of a transient occlusion of the brachial artery (same stimulus as for FMD measurement), in fasted state

secondary_outcome.description: Vascular endothelial function in the micro-vascular compartment will be assessed using the measurement of the hyperaemia half time using laser-Doppler system at the level of the skin of the hand by following the response to a reactive hyperaemia induced by the release of a transient occlusion of the brachial artery (same stimulus as for FMD measurement), in fasted state

secondary_outcome.description: Determination of TAG plasma concentration (g/L) (a metabolic parameter), on fasted state

secondary_outcome.measure: Plasma TAG dosage on 3h post prandial state
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1, Day 42, Day 70, Day 111, Day 139, Day 180
secondary_outcome.description: Determination of TAG plasma concentration (g/L) (a metabolic parameter), on post-prandial state 3h after the concomitant consumption of the study drink and challenge meal, on post-prandial state 3h after the concomitant consumption of the study drink and challenge meal.

secondary_outcome.measure: Plasma TAG dosage on 6h post prandial state
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1, Day 42, Day 70, Day 111, Day 139, Day 180
secondary_outcome.description: Determination of TAG plasma concentration (g/L) (a metabolic parameter), on post-prandial state 6h after the concomitant consumption of the study drink and challenge meal.

secondary_outcome.measure: Plasma uric acid dosage on fasted state
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1, Day 42, Day 70, Day 111, Day 139, Day 180
secondary_outcome.description: Determination of uric acid plasma concentration (mM) (a metabolic parameter) method, on fasted state

secondary_outcome.measure: Plasma uric acid on 3h post prandial state
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1, Day 42, Day 70, Day 111, Day 139, Day 180
secondary_outcome.description: Determination of uric acid plasma concentration (mM) (metabolic parameter), on post-prandial state 3h after the concomitant consumption of the study drink and challenge meal.

secondary_outcome.measure: Plasma uric acid on 6h post prandial state
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1, Day 42, Day 70, Day 111, Day 139, Day 180
secondary_outcome.description: Determination of uric acid plasma concentration (mM) (metabolic parameter) will be determined, on post-prandial state 6h after the concomitant consumption of the study drink and challenge meal.

secondary_outcome.measure: Plasma total cholesterol dosage
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day -14, Day 1, Day 42, Day 70, Day 111, Day 139, Day 180
secondary_outcome.description: Determination of total cholesterol plasma concentration (mM) (a metabolic parameter), on fasted state

secondary_outcome.measure: Plasma High Density Lipoprotein cholesterol (HDL-chol) dosage
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day -14, Day 1, Day 42, Day 70, Day 111, Day 139, Day 180
secondary_outcome.description: Determination of HDL-chol plasma concentration (mM) (a metabolic parameter), on fasted state

secondary_outcome.measure: Plasma High Density Lipoprotein cholesterol (LDL-chol) calculation
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day -14, Day 1, Day 42, Day 70, Day 111, Day 139, Day 180
secondary_outcome.description: Determination of LDL-chol plasma concentration (mM) (metabolic parameter), on fasted state

secondary_outcome.measure: Plasma Total Fatty Acids (FA) dosage
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1, Day 42, Day 70, Day 111, Day 139, Day 180
secondary_outcome.description: Determination of total FA plasma concentration (mM) (a metabolic parameter), on fasted state

secondary_outcome.measure: Serum Insulin dosage
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day -14, Day 1, Day 42, Day 70, Day 111, Day 139, Day 180
secondary_outcome.description: Determination of insulin serum concentration (mU/L or pM) (a metabolic parameter), on fasted state

secondary_outcome.measure: Weight measure
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day -14, Day 1, Day 42, Day 70, Day 111, Day 139, Day 180
secondary_outcome.description: the body weight (kg) will be recorded with a bathroom scale, on fasted state

secondary_outcome.measure: Height measure
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day -14
secondary_outcome.description: the body height (cm) will be measured with a stadiometer.

secondary_outcome.measure: Body Mass Index (BMI) calculation
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day -14, Day 1, Day 42, Day 70, Day 111, Day 139, Day 180
secondary_outcome.description: the BMI (kg/m²) will be calculated, on fasted state

secondary_outcome.measure: Waist circumference measure
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day -14, Day 1, Day 42, Day 70, Day 111, Day 139, Day 180
secondary_outcome.description: the waist circumference (cm) will be recorded with a measuring tape, on fasted state

secondary_outcome.measure: Fat mass ratio determination
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1, Day 42, Day 70, Day 111, Day 139, Day 180
secondary_outcome.description: The percentage of fat mass (percent) (body composition) will be determined on each participant using a multi-frequency bioelectrical Impedance Analyzer, on fasted state

secondary_outcome.measure: Lean mass ratio determination
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1, Day 42, Day 70, Day 111, Day 139, Day 180
secondary_outcome.description: The percentage of lean mass (percent) (body composition) will be determined on each participant using a multi-frequency bioelectrical Impedance Analyzer, on fasted state

secondary_outcome.measure: Water mass ratio determination
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1, Day 42, Day 70, Day 111, Day 139, Day 180
secondary_outcome.description: The percentage of water (percent) (body composition) will be determined using a multi-frequency bioelectrical Impedance Analyzer, on fasted state

secondary_outcome.measure: RNA profiling on fasted state
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 42, Day 111, Day 180
secondary_outcome.description: Nutrigenomic analysis will be performed from total Ribo Nucleic Acid (RNA) isolated blood collected in PAXgene Blood RNA Tube. The isolated RNA will be used to perform microarray analyses that allow identification of expression of all genes of the genome, on fasted state

secondary_outcome.measure: RNA profiling on 6h post prandial state
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 42, Day 111, Day 180
secondary_outcome.description: Analysis will be performed from total RNA isolated blood collected in PAXgene Blood RNA Tube. The isolated RNA will be used to perform microarray analyses that allow identification of expression of all genes of the genome, on post-prandial state 6h after the concomitant consumption of the study drink and challenge meal.

secondary_outcome.measure: Gut microbiota profiling
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1, Day 42, Day 70, Day 111, Day 139, Day 180
secondary_outcome.description: Identification of the microbiota composition of feces samples (collected by subjects) by performing a genetic sequencing analysis of bacterial DNA.

secondary_outcome.measure: Plasma carotenoids dosage
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1, Day 42, Day 70, Day 111, Day 139, Day 180
secondary_outcome.description: Carotenoids will be quantitated from plasma (nM), on fasted state

secondary_outcome.measure: Plasma vitamine C dosage
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1, Day 42, Day 70, Day 111, Day 139, Day 180
secondary_outcome.description: Vitamin C status will be quantified in deproteinized plasma (mg/L), on fasted state

secondary_outcome.measure: Treatment compliance
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 42, Day 111, Day 180
secondary_outcome.description: Treatment compliance (percent) will be determined using counting of empty orange drinks brought back by volunteers after the consumption periods

secondary_outcome.measure: Polyphenol intake
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1, Day 42, Day 111, Day 180
secondary_outcome.description: Polyphenol intake (ml/day) in basal and during treatment consumption periods will be determined by a dietician using food report completed by volunteers.

secondary_outcome.measure: Low-polyphenol diet compliance
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1, Day 42, Day 111, Day 180
secondary_outcome.description: Respect (y/n) of a low-polyphenol diet in basal (between Visit 1 - Visit 2) and during treatment consumption periods (between Visit 2 - Visit 3, Visit 4 - Visit 5, Visit 6 - Visit 7) will be determined by a dietician using 3 days food reports completed by volunteers.

secondary_outcome.measure: Calorie intake
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1, Day 42, Day 111, Day 180
secondary_outcome.description: Calorie (kcal/day) intake in basal and during treatment consumption periods will be determined by a dietician using food report completed by volunteers.

secondary_outcome.measure: Protein intake
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1, Day 42, Day 111, Day 180
secondary_outcome.description: Protein (g/day) intake in basal and during treatment consumption periods will be determined by a dietician using food report completed by volunteers.

secondary_outcome.measure: Lipid intake
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1, Day 42, Day 111, Day 180
secondary_outcome.description: Lipid intake (g/day) in basal and during treatment consumption periods will be determined by a dietician using food report completed by volunteers.

secondary_outcome.measure: Carbohydrate intake
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1, Day 42, Day 111, Day 180
secondary_outcome.description: Carbohydrate intake (g/day) in basal and during treatment consumption periods will be determined by a dietician using food report completed by volunteers.

secondary_outcome.measure: Diet division of protein/lipid/carbohydrate intakes
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1, Day 42, Day 111, Day 180
secondary_outcome.description: The overall distribution of the protein/lipid/carbohydrate food intakes (%) will be determined by a dietician using food report completed by volunteers.

secondary_outcome.measure: Diet stability
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 180
secondary_outcome.description: Diet stability (y/n) in terms of polyphenols, calories, proteins, carbohydrates and lipids intakes during the whole study will be determined by a dietician using the 4 food reports completed by volunteers.

secondary_outcome.measure: Biobank for food metabolome
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day -14, Day 1, Day 42, Day 70, Day 111, Day 139, Day 180
secondary_outcome.description: Urine samples will be stored for further assessment of food metabolome to potentially identify new bioactive compounds present in the juice that could contribute to the biological response after orange juice/HESP intake.

arm_group.description: 42 subjects between 40 and 65 years old with predisposition to cardiovascular disease will consume daily 330 ml of orange juice naturally rich in hesperidin (drink A) during 6 weeks

42 subjects between 40 and 65 years old with predisposition to cardiovascular disease will consume daily 330 ml of control beverage (drink B)- a soft drink with sugar concentration identical to drink A - during 6 weeks

arm_group.arm_group_label: Control beverage supplemented with hesperidin formulation (B+HESP)
arm_group.description: 42 subjects between 40 and 65 years old with predisposition to cardiovascular disease will consume daily 330 ml of control beverage (identical to drink B but supplemented with hesperidin to reach level of drink A) during 6 weeks

intervention.description: Volunteers will consume, in random order, daily 330 ml of 1 experimental beverage per period (Orange Juice, Control Beverage, Control Beverage supplemented with hesperidin) for 6 weeks in each period. At the beginning and the end of each period, exploration will be conducted at fasted state and at post-prandial state after the administration of a high-fat high-sugar meal.
intervention.arm_group_label: Control beverage supplemented with hesperidin formulation (B+HESP)
